lexUnit.name: shine.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to illuminate an object by giving out a bright light

sentence.text: He explained that their house down under the railway by the Bridge of Three Eyes had only one room , but his own eyes shone as he described the delights of a gypsy supper .
Nell emerged from the noise of the crowd and came across towards us , a clipboard clasped to her chest , her eyes shining .
` Thank you , my lord , " she said , her eyes shining with tears .
Even Ben 's eyes were shining , his usual boredom with just ` hanging around " not voiced , nor even hinted at .
` It was a fine fight , " Isay said , and his eyes were shining in the candlelight .
It has silenced her tears , and I bet her eyes are shining in the dark .
His dark eyes were shining hotly in the torchlight .
He shook both my hands together , his good honest face shining with happiness .
She was young , less than twenty , he guessed , on the verge of full womanhood , with a handsome oval face and healthy skin which shone translucent in the rain .
The moon shone overhead like a new dime .
NOBODY is sure of the distance to Betelgeuse , the red giant star that shines so brilliantly in the constellation of Orion .
For much of its life a star shines because of reactions in its core which convert hydrogen , the lightest of all the elements , into helium , the second lightest .
A hundred thousand stars shone hard and steady in an eternity of space .
Christmas in a wild Welsh valley with the stars shining on top of the mountains and everyone singing and singing , the way they all sang in Wales ; so beautifully , natural as birds !

But big golf today , as we know , is in America , where the sun shines .

The gleam of insulating oil shone bright on the prominences of his face , dimming and brightening again as she moved past him to hunker down at his side .
The lights of Alcatraz stood out like a ship in the bay , while on the other side shone the twinkling lights of Berkeley .
Bog grass on lower ground shone orange , emerald green or gold .
Three small pools below the lip of the crater shone turquoise in the sunlight .
The duller buildings blended with the desert , but others shone pink , blue and gold , edged with ornamental plasterwork in white .
There was a copper kettle boiling on one hob and a china teapot on the other and the stove shone clean .
The room dived into darkness , shrinking Chesarynth 's world to the chairs and benches shining pale in the moonlight from the window .
There was no one in the glare of the sun in the village street , and the brown earth shone yellow and the dogs and chickens sought the shade .
He 's a bewildered romantic ; optimism shines brightly in his eyes .
Two big gold caps shone brightly in his wide , gap-toothed grin .
A white sink shone at the far end , some sort of covered porcelain bucket underneath it .
Arty was sitting up in bed , his hair shining from a liberal application of something that looked and smelled like perfumed vaseline and came from a jar labelled Easi-Gro .
It shines quietly from the lubricating oil .
The bold black lettering on the construction board shone in the car headlights when Stephen turned into the wide , potholed drive up to Crystal Springs House .

Her voice was bitter , and tears shone in her red-rimmed eyes .
The river shone in the early light .
It was an enormous bungalow , with a central block roofed in green tiles which shone in the moonlight .
She threw the hood back , revealing gold hair that shone in the rain .
The oil-cloth that covered the kitchen table shone like new , except for cracked corners .
My well-worn schoolboy shoes were polished until they shone like glass .
The yellow skin freckled brown shone like the well-fingered ivories of a bar-room piano .
` A fine night for a fight ! " the Hearthware leader said , his teeth flashing and the blood shining on his sword .
Ahead of her , lighted windows shone through the dusk , and the air was filled with the scent of dying leaves , and moss , and the strains of music .

Cupboards , surfaces , refrigerator , cooker , everything shone with pristine cleanliness , no clutter of any kind in sight beyond an electric kettle , a large cast-iron cookpot on the back of the wood-burning Aga .

The hound , which was shining with phosphorus , chased Sir Charles down the Yew Alley .
He had expected a butler or some obsequious manservant , at the least a maid or companion , to welcome them into a room shining with silver and silk carpets .
Her face was still very pale , the skin shining with sweat , but the eyes were almost normal now , the pupils no longer dilated .
She lay on the bed and pulled the coverlet up over herself and the golden Satan shone behind her closed eyes .
Behind him was a kind of triptych with ferny foliage , to the left and right , enclosing a watery space in which rosy and silver fish shone between pond-weeds .
At first the child was rather afraid of Davis , whose scar shone whitely against the tan of his face .
The burnished copper shone bravely , having only the previous night survived unscathed a particularly concerted attack upon its person .

At the shorter wavelength , the rings are lit up by the Sun 's radiation and shine brilliantly ; but methane in Saturn 's atmosphere absorbs at this wavelength and so the planet itself is virtually invisible .

Dad 's hair was shining too , as he liked to put olive oil on it , convinced that this lubrication of the scalp banished baldness .
